thread.title_full: Inglis: I understand why Mundine will protest anthem | League | Sporting News

author: Sporting News
title: Inglis: I understand why Mundine will protest anthem | League | Sporting News
text:
February 1, 2017 2:45am EST February 1, 2017 1:51am EST Greg Inglis says he can see why Anthony Mundine will protest the national anthem. Sporting News 
Updated at 2:45 a.m. ET 
Updated at 2:45 a.m. ET 
South Sydney superstar Greg Inglis says he understands the reasons behind why Anthony Mundine will not appear until the national anthem has been played prior to his bout with Danny Green on Friday. 
MORE: Is Ben Barba about to turn his back on French rugby already? 
Mundine has revealed that he will protest the playing of the national anthem by not appearing until it is finished, when he and Green come together for a second time at the Adelaide Oval. 
‘The Man’ revealed he would be making a stand as a proud indigenous man, and Inglis was asked if he believed Mundine had a point. 
The Rabbitohs’ veteran said there were aspects of the national anthem that were unsatisfactory, however was quick to reiterate the fact that he has always respected the playing of the anthem. 
Take a look at what Inglis had to say about the matter in the video player above.
